message:
تم الوصول الى اجابة مرضية. لا حاجة للرد بعد الان.. 
شكرا جدا يا شباب... 

Hello guys... is it possible to send http headers on a request from the frontend. I'm talking a bout normal refresh on the page like going into a link not an ajax request... 

& sorry for my ignorance on the http subject...
On that matter: whats the best place i can learn how to understand & manage http requests. Share the resources please... 

Thanks in advance.

توضيح:
ازى احط header authorization من خلال get request عادى بالضغط على link او form من غير ajax  requests...

data.message:
What header you are willing to add?
Actually you can do it only with ajax calls, also keep in mind that you will be changing the "request" headers, not response ones 
Request headers may only be useful in providing authentication.. etc.. 
Other request headers are server, path, method,  etc.. 
They are easily set using standard ways of 
Anchor url and html form.

ماينفعش إلا إذا كنت مستخدم authorization من قبل على نفس الدومين 
Http basic auth مثلا
ممكن نساعدك لو قلتلنا ايه الهيدرز اللي عايز تبعتها .. لان بعضها تقدر تحدده من اللينك والبراوزر هيفهم ويبعتها وهوا بيطلب الصفحة
You shouldnt put any authontication header in get form. Thats a bad practice
by the way for testing you could use this chrome extension https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/modheader/idgpnmonknjnojddfkpgkljpfnnfcklj
Although it's a bad practice to send authorization in get request you can use the credentials to create unique token for one time use and destroy it after the request is processed

فاهم اللي انت عاوز تعمله وللأسف ما ينفعش ، لو عاوز مصدر كويس تفهم الدنيا أكتر أرشح لك سلسلة المقالات دي : 
http://odetocode.com/Articles/741.aspx
if you are talking about http browser requests , the short answer is NO, JavaScript even started after the response of the request.

if you want to send custom headers then YES , you can 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7686827/how-can-i-add-a-custom-http-header-to-ajax-request-with-js-or-jquery

if you want to modify the default headers then NO , you cant
